instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 1 - Questions 1-10 Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD OR A NUMBER.

questions.text:
Alex completed his training in 2014 .
About the applicant:
• At first Alex did his training in the 1____ department.
• Alex did not have a qualification from school in 2 ____.
• Alex thinks he should have done the diploma in 3 ____ skills.
• Age of other trainees: the youngest was 4 ____.

Benefits of doing training at JPNW:
• Trainees receive the same amount of 5 ____ as permanent staff.
• Trainees go to 6____ one day per month.
• The company is in a convenient 7 ____.

Advice for interview:
• Do not wear 8____
• Do not be 9 ____ .
• Make sure you 10 ____ .

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 2 - Questions 11-16. Choose the correct letter A, B, or C.

questions.text: <b>11. Annie recommends that when cross-country skiing, the visitors should
options: A get away from the regular trails
B stop to enjoy views of the scenery
C go at a slow speed at the beginning
questions.correct_answer: A get away from the regular trails

questions.text: <b>12. What does Annie tell the group about this afternoon’s dog-sled trip?
options: A Those who want to can take part in a race
B Anyone has the chance to drive a team of dogs
C One group member will be chosen to lead the trail
questions.correct_answer: B Anyone has the chance to drive a team of dogs

questions.text: <b>13. What does Annie say about the team relay event?
options: A All participants receive a medal
B The course is 4 km long
C Each team is led by a teacher
questions.correct_answer: A All participants receive a medal

questions.text: <b>14. On the snow-shoe trip, the visitors will
options: A visit an old gold mine
B learn about unusual flowers
C climb to the top of a mountain
questions.correct_answer: C climb to the top of a mountain

questions.text: <b>15. The cost of accommodation in the mountain hut includes
options: A a supply of drinking water
B transport of visitors’ luggage
C cooked meals
questions.correct_answer: A a supply of drinking water

questions.text: <b>16. If there is a storm while the visitors are in the hut, they should
options: A contact the bus driver
B wait until the weather improves
C use the emergency locator beacon
questions.correct_answer: B wait until the weather improves

questions.text:
Questions 17-20
What information does Annie give about skiing on each of the following mountain trails?
Choose FOUR answers from the options below and write the correct letter A-F next to questions 17-20

Information
A it has a good place to stop and rest.
B it is suitable for all abilities.
C it involves crossing a river.
D it demands a lot of skill.
E it may be closed in bad weather.
F it has some very narrow sections

17. Highland trail: _______
options: A it has a good place to stop and rest.
B it is suitable for all abilities.
C it involves crossing a river.
D it demands a lot of skill.
E it may be closed in bad weather.
F it has some very narrow sections
questions.correct_answer: B it is suitable for all abilities.

questions.text: 18. Pine trail: _______
options: A it has a good place to stop and rest.
B it is suitable for all abilities.
C it involves crossing a river.
D it demands a lot of skill.
E it may be closed in bad weather.
F it has some very narrow sections
questions.correct_answer: D it demands a lot of skill.

questions.text: 19. Stony trail: _______
options: A it has a good place to stop and rest.
B it is suitable for all abilities.
C it involves crossing a river.
D it demands a lot of skill.
E it may be closed in bad weather.
F it has some very narrow sections
questions.correct_answer: A it has a good place to stop and rest.

questions.text: 20. Loser’s trail: _______
options: A it has a good place to stop and rest.
B it is suitable for all abilities.
C it involves crossing a river.
D it demands a lot of skill.
E it may be closed in bad weather.
F it has some very narrow sections
questions.correct_answer: E it may be closed in bad weather.

sections.paragraph_title: Labels giving nutritional information on food packaging

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 3 - Questions 21-26. Choose the correct letter A, B, or C.

questions.text: <b>21. What was Jack’s attitude to nutritional food labels before this project?
options: A He didn’t read everything on them
B He didn’t think they were important
C He thought they were too complicated
questions.correct_answer: A He didn’t read everything on them

questions.text: <b>22. Alice says that before doing this project.
options: A she was unaware of what certain foods contained
B she was too lazy to read food labels
C she was only interested in the number of calories
questions.correct_answer: A she was unaware of what certain foods contained

questions.text: <b>23. When discussing supermarket brands of pizza, Jack agrees with Alice that
options: A the list of ingredients is shocking
B he will hesitate before buying pizza again
C the nutritional label is misleading
questions.correct_answer: C the nutritional label is misleading

questions.text: <b>24. Jack prefers the daily value system to other labelling systems because it is
options: A more accessible
B more logical
C more comprehensive

questions.text: <b>25. What surprised both students about one flavour of crisps?
options: A The percentage of artificial additives given was incorrect
B The products did not contain any meat
C The labels did not list all the ingredients
questions.correct_answer: B The products did not contain any meat

questions.text: <b>26. What do the students think about research into the impact of nutritional food labelling?
options: A It did not produce clear results
B It focused on the wrong people
C It made unrealistic recommendations
questions.correct_answer: A It did not produce clear results

questions.text:
Questions 27 and 28
Choose TWO letters A-E
Which TWO things surprised the students about the traffic-light system for nutritional labels?
options: A its widespread use
B the fact that it is voluntary for supermarkets
C how little research was done before its introduction
D its unpopularity with food manufacturers
E the way that certain colours are used
correct_answer: B the fact that it is voluntary for supermarkets
C how little research was done before its introduction

questions.text:
Questions 29 and 30.
Choose TWO letters A-E
Which TWO things are true about the participants in the study on the traffic-light system?
options: A They had low literacy levels.
B They were regular consumers of packaged food.
C They were selected randomly.
D They were from all socio-economic groups.
E They were interviewed face-to-face.
correct_answer: D They were from all socio-economic groups.

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 4 - Questions 31-40 Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.text:
Coffee in the Arab world
•These was small-scale trade in wild coffee from Ethiopia.
• 1522: Coffee was approved in the Ottoman court as a type of medicine.
• 1623: In Constantinople, the ruler ordered the 31 ____ of every coffee house.

Coffee arrives in Europe (17th century)
• Coffee shops were compared to 32 ____.
• They played an important part in social and 33 ____ changes.

Coffee and European colonisation
• European powers established coffee plantations in their coloniesTypes of coffee were often named according to the 34____ they came from.
• In Brazil and the Caribbean, most cultivation depended on 35 ____.
• In Java, coffee was used as a form of 36 ____.
• Coffee became almost as important as 37 ____.
• The move towards the consumption of 38____ in Britain did not also take place in the USA.

Coffee in the 19th century
• Prices dropped because of improvements in the 39 ____ .
• Industrial workers found coffee helped them to work at 40 ____
